Class MySQLSpecific

  • java.lang.Object

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JdbcSpecific

    public class MySQLSpecific
extends AbstractJdbcSpecific
    My SQL specific behaviour.

      • isBackslashEscaping

        public boolean isBackslashEscaping()
        Description copied from interface: JdbcSpecific
        Quote in string can be escaped in two ways:
        • 'hello '' foobar '' world' <- standard way
        • 'hello \' foobar \' world' <- MySQL way
        Specified by:
        isBackslashEscaping in interface JdbcSpecific
        Overrides:
        isBackslashEscaping in class AbstractJdbcSpecific
        Returns:
        true when quote character can also be escaped with backslash.

      • jetelType2sqlDDL

        public java.lang.String jetelType2sqlDDL(DataFieldMetadata field)
        Description copied from interface: JdbcSpecific
        Converts field Clover metadata into SQL DDL type... e.g. for a fixed length string Clover field it returns "CHAR(15)", etc. Similar to sqlType2str but this one is more precise as it knows more about the particular clover field
        Specified by:
        jetelType2sqlDDL in interface JdbcSpecific
        Overrides:
        jetelType2sqlDDL in class AbstractJdbcSpecific
        Returns:
